work.position: DevOps Engineer | Sector: Postal and Logistics Services
work.summary: As a DevOps Engineer, I was responsible for modernizing and streamlining the CI/CD process by developing Azure DevOps pipelines for building and deploying microservices to AKS. I introduced reusable pipeline templates to simplify workflows, adopted Sealed Secrets for secure secret management, and installed Cert-Manager to manage certificates across the ecosystem.  Additionally, I deployed and managed Keycloak, an IAM solution, via Helm on AKS to improve authentication and authorization across microservices. I also set up and maintained a PostgreSQL server, ensuring reliable database services across all microservices.  Furthermore, I developed pipelines for publishing internal libraries and ensured AKS manifests were managed in a dedicated repository, aligning with GitOps principles. This approach enhanced security, scalability, and the overall efficiency of the platform.
highlights: Development of Azure DevOps pipelines for build and deployment to AKS.
Implementation of reusable pipeline templates to simplify and standardize the CI/CD process.
Adoption of Sealed Secrets to securely manage encrypted secrets within the repository.
Installation and configuration of Cert-Manager for certificate management in microservices deployed to AKS.
Deployment and management of Keycloak, an IAM solution, via Helm on AKS.
Setup and administration of a PostgreSQL server used across all microservices.
Development of pipelines for publishing internal libraries.
Management of AKS manifests in a dedicated repository, integrating GitOps principles into the CD process.
